identificationModule.officialTitle: CAncer Survivor CArdiomyopathy DEtection Pilot Study

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this study is to improve the cardiovascular care of adult cancer survivors. The goal is to obtain the data necessary to plan and develop a nation-wide network of a screening program that can help provide cost-effective and long-term monitoring.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: The primary objective of this study is to define the diagnostic performance and optimal cutoffs of AI-ECG and NT-pro-BNP for the detection of left ventricular dysfunction (LVD, defined as a left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) \<50%) in cancer patients at 1 year after completion of anthracycline-based chemotherapy.

armGroups.label: 1 year follow-up
armGroups.description: patients who were treated in the year before and are now returning for their 1-year follow-up.

armGroups.label: Prior to anthracycline-based therapy
armGroups.description: patients presenting before the start of anthracycline-based therapy, then to be followed thereafter for 1 year and thereby contributing to the pool of patients with 1-year post-anthracycline assessment.

interventions.name: Electrocardiogram
interventions.description: electrodes are placed on certain spots and a reading obtained to measure the voltage of the heart

primaryOutcomes.measure: Diagnostic performance of AI-ECG for left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) < 50%
primaryOutcomes.description: Determination of the sensitivity, specificity, positive and negative prediction value as well as area under the curve for receiver operating characteristics for the 12-lead AI ECG algorithm for an LVEF \<50%

primaryOutcomes.measure: Diagnostic performance of NT-pro-BNP for left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) < 50%
primaryOutcomes.description: Determination of the sensitivity, specificity, positive and negative prediction value as well as area under the curve for receiver operating characteristics for NT-pro-BNP \>125 for an LVEF \<50%

primaryOutcomes.measure: Diagnostic performance of AI-ECG and NT-pro-BNP for left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) < 50%
primaryOutcomes.description: Determination of the sensitivity, specificity, positive and negative prediction value as well as area under the curve for receiver operating characteristics for the 12-lead AI ECG algorithm and NT-pro-BNP \>125 combined for an LVEF \<50%

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Absolute change in LVEF from baseline to 1 year from anthracycline-based therapy
secondaryOutcomes.description: Calculation of the the change in LVEF from baseline to 1 year from anthracycline-based therapy

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Absolute change in AI-ECG probability for LVEF <50% from baseline to 1 year from anthracycline-based therapy
secondaryOutcomes.description: Calculation of the change in AI-ECG probability of LVEF \<50% from baseline to 1 year from anthracycline-based therapy

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Correlation of change in LVEF and AI-ECG probability of LVEF <50% from baseline to 1 year from anthracycline-based therapy
secondaryOutcomes.description: Calculation of the correlation coefficient of change in LVEF and AI-ECG probability of LVEF \<50% from baseline to 1 year from anthracycline-based therapy

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Absolute change in NT-pro-BNP from baseline to 1 year from anthracycline-based therapy
secondaryOutcomes.description: Calculation of the change NT-pro-BNP from baseline to 1 year from anthracycline-based therapy

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Correlation of change in LVEF and NT-pro-BNP from baseline to 1 year from anthracycline-based therapy
secondaryOutcomes.description: Calculation of the correlation coefficient of change in LVEF and NT-pro-BNP from baseline to 1 year from anthracycline-based therapy

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* ≥18 years of age prior to enrollment and anthracycline start date
* diagnosis of breast cancer, lymphoma, or sarcoma with either planned or at 1 year after completion of anthracycline therapy, including patients from 6-12 months and greater than 1 year post-anthracycline exposure.

Exclusion Criteria:

* LVEF \<50% or prior confirmed history of cardiomyopathy, heart failure, persistent atrial fibrillation, left bundle branch block, or paced rhythm
* Individuals with pacemakers, defibrillators, or other implanted electronic devices
* Inability/unwillingness of individual to give written informed consent
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: 200 cancer survivors who are 1 year out from anthracycline-based therapy.
